Problem:
Consider a complex function defined as \\( z(t) = x(t) + i y(t) \\), where x(t) and y(t) follow the differential equations \\( \\dot{x} = Ax(t) \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By(t) \\) respectively, with A and B being scalar constants. We examine the effect of applying the Laplace transform on these functions, denoted as \\( Z(s) \\).

If an operational matrix P is applied to modify \\( Z(s) \\) mid-calculation at a certain s value, will the final inverse transform results still directly represent x(t) and y(t) for all t?
Explanation: Applying an operational matrix P modifies the structure of \\( Z(s) \\) in the s-domain, which alters how x(t) and y(t) are recovered post inverse transformation. The modification could change the dynamics or add additional terms/features not originally present.
